Articles.Content:
Why does the official KSP-TV channel stream non-KSP games? I get that the individual streamers that are featured play other games, but I honestly don't expect non-KSP content on the official channel.

Example, 2014-12-20 at 01:15 UTC:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/Misc/KSPTV.png

Simultaneously, ShimmyTheJJ is streaming KSP. It's just odd, why not have his stream be the official KSP-TV stream rather than featuring some non-KSP game?

Hi, Red Iron Crown. Dahud's copy of KSP was acting up during his slot today, rendering it nearly unplayable. Instead of no show, Dahud decided to stream something else to entertain the crowd that was still hanging out. We found this to be a fun breath of fresh air and wouldn't mind if it happens again, but just not too often

Hi, Red Iron Crown. Dahud's copy of KSP was acting up during his slot today, rendering it nearly unplayable. Instead of no show, Dahud decided to stream something else to entertain the crowd that was still hanging out. We found this to be a fun breath of fresh air and wouldn't mind if it happens again, but just not too often

Well, I guess thats a respectable answer. Cant argue with technical difficulties.
Thanks for the quick response, Rowsdower, makes sense to me.

It mightbe kinda fun to feature other space or physics games and have commentary on it from a KSP perspective. IE: What's wrong with physics/things that KSP might learn from. It would make a good refresher between long streams or something.

It mightbe kinda fun to feature other space or physics games and have commentary on it from a KSP perspective. IE: What's wrong with physics/things that KSP might learn from. It would make a good refresher between long streams or something.

Oh, yeah. That'd be neat.
